summary: Experienced professional with key strengths in research methodology, data analysis, political engagement, youth development, team leadership and accomplishments in coordination. A motivated, energetic and outgoing individual with strengths in Political Science, Young People’s Civic Engagement and Political Development. Focused on bottom-line, well-organized and action-oriented problem solver who thrives on innovative challenges. Excellent interpersonal skills in a variety of working environments, including organizations management.

profile_positions.description: Create an organization that carries all the revolution event in Malaysia same what is happening Yemen. Prepare presentations about the Yemeni revolution and present them at local and International Meetings, Conferences organized by different International NGOs. Translate the goals of Yemeni Youth and submitted to United Nations in Malaysia. Implement the revolution activities in Malaysia and call the Yemeni society to participate and support the revolution. Prepare the celebration of the revolution anniversary yearly from 2011 up to the present. Collaborates with other NGOs to create workshops or experiential events for the general public or targeted donor audiences about the revolution, citizenship, and social justice.
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder of Yemeni Youth for Change

profile_positions.description: Develop and maintain a network of enthusiastic and competent volunteers and professionals to participate in center activities and programs. Encourage and initiate identity and citizenship awareness activities and strive to maximize the involvement of the  Yemeni youth. Facilitate training of Yemenion center members in political and social identification, assessment, and monitoring techniques through the center of workshops and training courses. Advising the Yemeni governments on the perspectives of young people on issues of sustainable development. Provided support and supervision to the project managers and provides leadership training with an entrepreneurial spirit as well as sharing of best practices, workshops, and training programs. Developed seminars, researches, and Yemenioun Initiative for peace in Yemen and send it to the governments and NGOs. Working with the team in preparing social, political, and historical studies about Yemen.
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Officer

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for the public relations communication with the NGOs that are actively working in Yemen. This communication aims to collect data from the ground about the current political movement in Yemen. Also, I represent the center in local and International Meetings, Conferences organized by different International NGOs. Also, I was responsible to draft the partentership agreements.
profile_positions.title: Public Relation Officer

profile_positions.location: Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description: Uniklik.com was established to give services to undergraduate and postgraduates searching for opportunities to study abroad to find the most appropriate courses and the most suitable environment of their preference. The platform was establish based on the thousands of students' inquires and questions. We analyze these questions and come with this project to answer all the possible questions that international students ask to complete their study overseas.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager of Universities Search Engine

profile_positions.description: Served around 580 students in three years to enroll to different universities in Malaysia public and private. Consulting students regarding their different future courses and provide them with the necessary information about the living and study in Malaysia. Establishing universities search engine for universities’ courses and possible opportunities in the universities. Establishing Arabic students quid to study in Malaysia. Establishing strong corporate with universities and get discounts on the tuition fees for specific countries. Establishing Salaysia Academic Awards for outstanding students.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager

profile_positions.location: Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
profile_positions.description:
Salaysia award is a set of awards presented to students who have accomplished outstanding performances during their undergraduate and postgraduate studies. It consists of two kinds of awards:

· Academic Salaysia Award is presented to 10 students based on their performances and accumulated grades for each field of study.
· The Salaysia Gold Medal is given to only one student who has outperformed in more than a filed.

Academic Salaysia Award Each winner is awarded also a field related descriptive title. Meaning, the winner in the field of architecture engineering is awarded the title of: Salaysia Architect. Salaysia Gold Medal The winner of this gold medal is called the Salaysia Medalist
profile_positions.title: Project Manager of Salaysia Awards 10 + 1

I was managed to organize various activities that aim to improve the student's academic and development skills. Also, I organize other activities that Yemeni heritage and culture for the international student at the university. When I organize the Yemeni Cultural Night, more than 1200 students attended the event at the University.

Deliver candid and timely communication counsel and guidance to the headquarter of the Union in Yemen. Represent the Union at local and International Meetings, Conferences organized by different International NGOs. Developed and implemented annual partnership engagement and resource mobilization plans for the projects in different cities. Serve as a projects manager development and organization for many the Union programs in Malaysia. Dealing with inquiries from the public, the press, and related organizations. Speaking publicly at interviews, press conferences, and presentations.
Collaborates with Union’s officers to create workshops or experiential events for the general public or targeted donor audiences.
